summary: The Equal Dignity for Married Taxpayers Act aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to ensure that all legally married same-sex couples are treated the same as other married couples under federal tax laws. The bill makes numerous changes, replacing gendered terms and phrases like "husband and wife" and "his/her spouse" with gender-neutral alternatives like "married couple" and "the individual's spouse" throughout the tax code. It covers a wide range of tax provisions, ensuring equal application regardless of sexual orientation.
